title: The best movies on Netflix right now (February 2026)
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix offers a curated list of top movies including classics and Netflix originals for diverse tastes.
Highlighted films include 'Ex Machina', 'Hell or High Water', 'You’ve Got Mail', and 'The Irishman'.
The list is updated monthly and categorized by genres like drama, comedy, horror, and more.

title: Ayer man accused in racist confrontation hit with new charges tied to boat vandalism
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: David McPartlan, 67, from Ayer, charged with vandalism and intimidating a witness, has been held without bail.
McPartlan allegedly ordered an employee to vandalize victim Sheron Brown's boat after a prior racist incident.
Released on personal recognizance earlier, McPartlan's bail was revoked for violating a no-contact order with the victim.

title: This is the top Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, according to Coffeeness
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Buffalo chicken dip is the most-searched Super Bowl snack in Massachusetts, as per Google search analysis by Coffeeness.
Buffalo chicken dip ranks No. 1 nationally, being the top Super Bowl snack in 31 states, according to Coffeeness.
In Massachusetts, pico de gallo is the most-searched healthy Super Bowl snack, Coffeeness data reveals.

title: Trump isn’t making a Super Bowl pick, but his press secretary isn’t staying impartial: ‘Go Patriots!’
author: John Waller
bullets: President Trump isn't making a Super Bowl prediction despite recent interactions with Patriots owner Robert Kraft.
White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt, a New Hampshire native, expressed support for the Patriots.
Trump will not attend the Super Bowl but will have an interview with NBC airing before the game.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals on Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston is expected to see snow starting late Friday due to an arctic front, lasting into Saturday.
Predicted snowfall totals vary, with 2-4 inches in general and 4-6 inches possible in heavier bands.
Coastal areas could receive 3-6 inches, influenced by ocean enhancement and snow showers through Saturday night.

title: Think you know the Patriots’ Super Bowl history? Take the quiz.
author: Kelly Chan and Hayden Bird
bullets: The article offers a quiz on the New England Patriots' Super Bowl history as they face the Seahawks on Sunday.
The quiz recalls the Patriots' historic Super Bowl LI victory, where they overcame a 28-3 deficit to win 34-28.
Readers can explore more Patriots stories and updates by signing up for Boston sports news through email notifications.

title: Patriots star Christian Gonzalez has a big fan in Bruins legend Zdeno Chara
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez honors Boston sports legends with custom-made pregame t-shirts.
Bruins legend Zdeno Chara praised Gonzalez's gesture and his performance in the postseason.
Gonzalez recorded a 39.3% completion percentage, the lowest for a defender with 25+ targets this postseason.

title: Inside the origin of the Patriots’ ‘road warriors’ rallying cry
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots opt for road white uniforms in Super Bowl LX despite being the designated home team.
The 'road warriors' rallying cry originated from Coach Mike Vrabel showing clips from 1980s wrestling and the film 'The Warriors.'
Patriots hold a perfect 9-0 record in away games this season, embracing 'road warriors' identity.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of trending stories in Greater Boston.
Peter Chianca, the general assignment editor since 2019, oversees the quiz.
The quiz aims to engage readers with current events in the Greater Boston region.

title: Legendary Patriots kicker Adam Vinatieri elected to Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Adam Vinatieri, NFL's all-time scoring leader, was elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame during the NFL Honors.
Vinatieri is renowned for his significant kicks, including two game-winning Super Bowl kicks with the Patriots in 2001 and 2003.
At age 53, Vinatieri joins the Hall alongside Luke Kuechly, Larry Fitzgerald, Drew Brees, and Roger Craig, all elected this year.
